Term Definition:
This is the maximum payment the plan will pay for a covered health care service.  May 
also be called “eligible expense,” “payment allowance,” or “negotiated rate.” Synonym: eligible expense, payment allowance, and negotiated rate

A request that your health insurer or plan review a 
decision that denies a benefit or payment (either in whole or in part). Synonym: challenge, review request

When a provider bills you for the balance remaining on the bill that your plan doesn’t 
cover. This amount is the difference between the actual billed amount and the allowed amount. Synonym: suprise billing, out-of-network billing

A request for a benefit (including reimbursement of a health care expense) made by you or your health care provider to your health insurer or plan for items or services you think are covered. Synonym: benefit request, insurance claim

Your share of the costs of a covered health care service, calculated as a percent (for 
example, 20%) of the allowed amount for the service. You pay the coinsurance plus any deductibles you owe. Synonym: cost-sharing, shared payment

Health care providers, emergency facilities, and insurance plans must follow rules that 
protect consumers from surprise medical bills. Synonym: grievance, concern, issue

A fixed amount (for example, $15) you pay for a covered health care service, usually when 
you receive the service (sometimes called “copay”). Synonym: copay, fixed fee

Your share of costs for services that a plan covers that you must pay out of your own 
pocket (sometimes called “out-of-pocket costs”). Synonym: sharing costs, out-of-pocket expenses
Discounts that reduce the amount you pay for certain services covered by an individual plan you buy through the Marketplace. Synonym: subsidies, financial assistance
An amount you could owe during a coverage period (usually one year) for covered health care services before your plan begins to pay. Synonym: excess, initial payment
Tests to figure out what your health problem is.  For example, an x-ray can be a diagnostic test to see if you have a broken bone. Synonym: medical test, screening

If you don’t have insurance or don’t plan to use your insurance to pay for your care, you may be able to use the patient-provider dispute resolution process if you disagree with your medical bill. Synonym: disagreement, conflict
Equipment and supplies ordered by a health care provider for everyday or extended use. Synonym: medical devices, assistive equipment, home medical supplies

This is a summary from your health plan of the total charges for the 
health care services you received and how much you and your health plan will have to pay. Synonym: EOB, benefit statement, insurance summary

An illness, injury, symptom (including severe pain), or condition severe enough to risk serious danger to your health if you didn’t get medical attention right away. Synonym: critical condition, urgent health issue
Ambulance services for an emergency medical condition. Synonym: ambulance service, emergency transport
Services to check for an emergency medical condition and treat you to keep an emergency medical condition from getting worse. Synonym: ER service, emergency treatement
Health care services that your plan doesn’t pay for or cover. Synonym: non-covered services, uncovered care
A list of drugs your plan covers.  A formulary may include how much your share of the cost is for each drug. Synonym: drug list, approved medications
A complaint that you communicate to your health insurer or plan. Synonym: complaint, concern, formal objection

An estimate from a health care provider or facility for the expected costs of 
items or services. Synonym: cost estimate, projected billing
A contract that requires a health insurer to pay some or all of your health care costs in exchange for a premium. Synonym: medical coverage, insurance policy
Your share (for example, 20%) of the allowed amount for covered healthcare services. Synonym: preferred provider cost-sharing, network percentage
A fixed amount (for example, $15) you pay for covered health care services to providers who contract with your health insurance or plan. Synonym: network copay, preferred provider fee

Providers or facilities that have a contract with your health plan to provide 
services for plan members at certain costs. Synonym: preferred providers, participating doctors, contracted physicians

Someone with health insurance (this can include people with insurance through their employer or health insurance they bought through the Health Insurance Marketplace®, directly from an insurance company or through an insurance agent or broker, Medicare, Medicaid, or TRICARE). Synonym: policyholder, covered individual

Yearly amount the federal government sets as the most each individual or family can be required to pay in cost sharing during the plan year for covered, in-network services. Synonym: out-of-pocket maximum, spending cap

Health care services or supplies needed to prevent, diagnose, or treat an illness, injury, condition, disease, or its symptoms, including habilitation, and that meet accepted standards of medicine.  Synonym: essential care, required treatment
The facilities, providers and suppliers your health insurer or plan has contracted with to provide health care services. Synonym: provider network, care network

A federal law that provides protections against getting surprise medical bills for out-
of-network emergency services, some out-of-network non-emergency services related to a patient visit to an in-network facility, and out-of-network air ambulance services. Synonym: surprise billing protection, balance billing law

A form you may get from out-of-network providers or facilities that tells you 
about your rights and protections against surprise medical bills and that gives you the option to waive those rights. Synonym: disclosure form, patient agreement, informed consent

Your share (for example, 40%) of the allowed amount for covered health care services to providers who don’t contract with your health insurance or plan. Synonym: external provider percentage, non-network cost-sharing
A fixed amount (for example, $30) you pay for covered health care services from providers who do not contract with your health insurance or plan. Synonym: non-network copay, external provider fee
A provider who doesn’t have a contract with your plan to provide services. Synonym: external physician, non-participating provider

The most you could pay during a coverage period (usually one year) for your share 
of the costs of covered services. Synonym: spending cap, maximum personal expense, cost cieling

Health coverage issued to you directly (individual plan) or through an employer, union or other group sponsor (employer group plan) that provides coverage for certain health care costs. Synonym: policy, coverage option, insurance package

A provider who has a contract with your health insurer or plan who has agreed to 
provide services to members of a plan. Synonym: in-network doctor, contracted physician
The amount that must be paid for your health insurance or plan. Synonym: monthly payment, insurnace fee, coverage cost
An individual or facility that provides health care services. Synonym: healthcare professional, medical practioner
A written order from your primary care provider for you to see a specialist or get certain health care services. Synonym: specialist recommendation, care direction

A type of preventive care that includes tests or exams to detect the presence of something, usually performed when you have no symptoms, signs, or prevailing medical history of a disease or condition. Synonym: prevention test, health check, early detection exam
When someone who has health insurance chooses to pay their health care costs out of pocket without using health insurance. Synonym: out-of-pocket payment, direct payment

A provider focusing on a specific area of medicine or a group of patients to diagnose, manage, prevent, or treat certain types of symptoms and conditions. Synonym: medical expert, specialized physician

An unexpected balance bill for certain types of out-of-network costs your insurance didn’t 
cover. Synonym: unexpected charge, balance billing
Someone without health care coverage. Synonym: without coverage, non-insured, lacking insurance

Care for an illness, injury, or condition serious enough that a reasonable person would seek care right away, but not so severe as to require emergency room care. Synonym: immediate care, prompt medical service
